name: Cream Dory Okra Adlai with Cane Vinegar Okra Dip
description: Indulge in a healthful delight with our Cream Dory Okra Adlai recipe, perfectly complemented by a Cane Vinegar Okra Dip. This dish is an innovative twist on Healthy Recipes and Healthified Recipes, aimed at those who are looking to enjoy high-sodium flavors in a more nutritious manner. A combination of creamy dory fish, crisp okra, and the nutty flavors of Adlai (Job's Tears), paired with a tangy cane vinegar dip, promises a delicious and wholesome meal.
recipeIngredient: 0.33  cup raw, Butternut Squash Raw Shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the 율무 (Job's Tears) under cold water until the water runs clear.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the 율무 (Job's Tears) according to package instructions until tender, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the okra pods and shred the butternut squash.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the organic eggplant into small cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Season the cream dory fillet with garlic juice and set aside for marination.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan, lightly fry the cream dory fillet until golden brown and fully cooked, about 7 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, sauté the okra, butternut squash, and eggplant until they're softened, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the cooked 율무 (Job's Tears) with the sautéed vegetables and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: For the dip, mix 1 Tbsp of cane vinegar with the juice of 3 cloves of garlic. Adjust the quantity as per taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Cream Dory and vegetable mix hot with the Cane Vinegar Okra Dip on the side.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 10
